New Records: Dylan Crews hit his second career home run, becoming the first Nationals rookie since 2022 to homer in back-to-back games. He also ranked third in Nationals team history for extra-base hits behind Ian Desmond and Danny Espinosa.
Key Match Events: The Cubs scored seven runs in the second inning, including key hits by Isaac Paredes, Nico Hoerner, Dansby Swanson, and Cody Bellinger's home run. The Nationals had a three-run ninth-inning rally but fell short.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Martinez praised the team's resilience and effort despite the loss. Dylan Crews expressed confidence in his performances, and Jake Irvin reflected on his struggles in the second inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs' rally in the second inning and the Nationals' late-game rally were significant moments in the game.
